A dog salivates at the sound of a bell after repeated pairings with food
A student receives a reward for completing a task
A child mimics a teacher's behavior after observing them

Learning only occurs in structured classroom settings

Using prior knowledge to process new information

An AI-driven tutoring system that adjusts content based on student progress

The ease with which users can identify system errors

The visual appeal of a design

To reduce cognitive load by simplifying content

Mental effort wasted on processing irrelevant information

Cognitive strategies are used exclusively in high-pressure situations, while metacognitive strategies are used during routine learning.
There is no clear distinction; both strategies serve the same function in learning.

It is the deliberate suppression of negative emotions to enhance academic performance.
It represents a motivational surge triggered by unexpected positive feedback.
